A company uses Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.

Three assets at a single location all need the same tune-up. A single worker can complete all three tune-ups. The worker’s hours must be allocated to each asset.

You need to configure the system for the worker.

Which configuration should you use?

choices.A: Configure the operations resource and set it to human resource.
choices.C: Create a consumption registration for the expenses.
choices.D: Create one work order and split hours by work order job.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Create one work order and split hours by work order job. Here’s why:
A single work order can encompass the maintenance of all three assets at one location.
Within the work order, you can create separate jobs or tasks (one for each asset’s tune-up).
The worker’s hours can then be logged and split across these jobs, ensuring accurate allocation to each asset as required.
